sentences.en: A hardening agent mixed with the monomer will induce polymerization.
sentences.cn: 固化剂与这种单体混合将引起聚合反应.

sentences.en: Certain chemicals can induce undesirable changes in the nervous system.
sentences.cn: 有些化学物质能在神经系统中引起不良变化.

sentences.en: Clouds are sometimes seeded with silver iodide to induce precipitation.
sentences.cn: 人们有时在云里播撒碘化银,以诱使降雨.

sentences.en: Doctors said surgery could induce a heart attack.
sentences.cn: 医生们说手术有可能引起心脏病发作。

sentences.en: He might decide that it is best to induce labour.
I would do anything to induce them to stay.
sentences.cn: 我会想尽一切办法劝他们留下来。

sentences.en: It was only a substantial meal that could induce in him even a passing taciturnity.
sentences.cn: 只有实实在在的一顿饭才能使他暂时缄口无言.

sentences.en: Lack of proper care and love in early childhood can induce criminal behavior in young people.
sentences.cn: 童年时代缺少适当的关怀和疼爱会导致青春期的犯罪行为.

sentences.en: Music can induce a meditative state in the listener.
sentences.cn: 音乐能够引导倾听者沉思。

sentences.en: Nothing would induce me to vote for him again.
sentences.cn: 没有什么能诱使我再投他的票了。

sentences.en: Patients with eating disorders may use drugs to induce vomiting.
sentences.cn: 患有进食障碍的人可使用药物催吐。

sentences.en: She had to be induced because the baby was four weeks late.
sentences.cn: 她的孩子晚了四星期仍未出生，因此要给她引产。

sentences.en: She was using all her powers of persuasion to induce the Griffins to remain in Rollway.
sentences.cn: 她在极力劝说格里芬斯一家留在罗尔威。

sentences.en: Taking a brisk walk can often induce a feeling of well-being.
sentences.cn: 快步行走常常会使人感到身心舒畅。

sentences.en: The price is not attractive enough to induce business.
sentences.cn: 价格不足以引起兴趣,达成交易.

sentences.en: The season does induce a quickening of the blood and a heightening of humankind's sensual pleasures.
sentences.cn: 这个季节的确会加速血液循环、提高人们感官的兴奋程度.
疫苗也引起细胞介导免疫.

words.tran_cn: [数] 归纳的；[电] 感应的；诱导的
[遗] 诱导物；引诱者；导流片；电感器
[电磁] 感应；归纳法；感应现象
感应器；授职者；圣职授予的人

trans.tran_en: to persuade someone to do something, especially something that does not seem wise

trans.tran_cn: 引诱，引起，劝说，用人工方法引(产)
trans.tran_en: to persuade someone to do something, especially something that does not seem wise
